verses.roman:
kṛṣṇera madhura rūpa, śuna, sanātana
ye rūpera eka kaṇa, ḍubāya saba tribhuvana,
sarva prāṇī kare ākarṣaṇa

synonyms: kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; madhura—sweet; rūpa—form; śuna—please hear; sanātana—O My dear Sanātana; ye rūpera—of which form; eka kaṇa—even a fraction; ḍubāya—floods; saba—all; tri-bhuvana—the three worlds; sarva prāṇī—all living entities; kare—does; ākarṣaṇa—attracting.
translation: "My dear Sanātana, the sweet, attractive transcendental form of Kṛṣṇa is so nice. Just try to understand it. Even a fractional understanding of Kṛṣṇa's beauty can merge all three worlds in the ocean of love. He attracts all the living entities within the three worlds.
